title: AI System Classification Standard
description: This standard defines the requirements and process for classifying AI systems according to EU AI Act risk categories (prohibited, high-risk, limited-risk, minimal-risk) to ensure appropriate compliance obligations are applied to each AI system throughout its lifecycle.

kpis.name: Classification Completeness
kpis.definition: % of AI systems with current, valid classification
kpis.measurementMethod: (# AI systems classified / # total AI systems) × 100

kpis.name: Classification Timeliness
kpis.definition: Average business days from classification request to decision

kpis.name: Annual Review Completion Rate
kpis.definition: % of AI systems reviewed annually on schedule
kpis.measurementMethod: (# annual reviews completed on time / # annual reviews due) × 100

kpis.name: Reclassification Responsiveness
kpis.definition: % of triggered reclassifications completed within SLA

kpis.name: High-Risk Compliance Rate
kpis.definition: % of high-risk AI systems with full compliance to required standards
kpis.measurementMethod: (# high-risk AI fully compliant / # high-risk AI systems) × 100

kpis.name: Prohibited Practice Prevention
kpis.definition: Number of prohibited practices in development or operation

kpis.name: Classification Accuracy
kpis.definition: % of classifications validated as accurate in audits
kpis.measurementMethod: (# accurate classifications in sample / # classifications audited) × 100

kpis.name: Documentation Package Completeness
kpis.definition: % of AI systems with complete documentation packages

kpis.name: Authority Response Time
kpis.definition: Average business days to respond to authority documentation requests

kpis.name: Classification Register Accuracy
kpis.definition: % of Classification Register fields complete and accurate
